headline.main: THE ADAMS EXPRESS ROBBERY.; Trial of the Alleged Robbers at Bridgeport, Connecticut. FIFTH DAY-CONTINUED.

docs.lead_paragraph: At the opening of the Court, this morning, Dr. Alexander Hugart was recalled, and the cross-examination continued by Mr.Seward.

headline.main: CITY AND COUNTY AFFAIRS.; BOARD OF ALDERMEN. TINKERING THE CHARTER THE QUESTION OF ACCOMMODATIONS FOR THE COURTS A SHOWER OF INVESTIGATING COMMITTEES PROPOSED LIST OF THE STANDING COMMITTEE. THE NEW COURT BUILDING. TINKERING THE CHARTER. ECONOMY IN PRINTING. ANOTHER INVESTIGATING COMMITTEE. EXTRA CLERKS. STANDING COMMITTEES.

docs.lead_paragraph: At the meeting of the Board last evening, a resolution was offered by Alderman BOOLE, and adopted, providing, it the Councilmen concur, for a Special Committee of five to investigate the present manner of publishing the proceedings of the Board, at present complained of as not giving sufficient publicity.

headline.main: BROOKLYN NEWS.; Common Council. ANNUAL REPORT OF THE HEALTH OFFICER THE BULKHEAD AT THE FOOT OF FULTON-STREET.

docs.snippet: In this Court yesterday, before City Judge McCUNN, Valentine Trainor and Henry Coine, indicted for robbery, were tried and acquitted.

headline.main: Court of General Sessions.; INDICTED FOR ROBBERY ACQUITTED.

docs.lead_paragraph: In this Court yesterday, before City Judge McCUNN, Valentine Trainor and Henry Coine, indicted for robbery, were tried and acquitted.
